revised_title: The Role of Blood Fluids in Intracellular Digestion of Bacteria and Red Blood Corpuscles
tldr: The author investigates the role of blood fluids in the intracellular digestion of bacteria and red blood corpuscles. They find that unheated serum enhances the digestion process, suggesting the presence of a "protryptic" property in the serum that prepares organisms for digestion by leucocytic digestive fluids.
